line.en: 'Geez, OK, I'll carry your bags for you.'
'Oh, I'm glad you understand that! I'll buy you a\ndonut!'
'That's a bit stingy... Well, that'll be fine.'
I feel a slightly hard done by as I see Kotori\noff, then follow Ageha.
'Let's go, let's go!'
'What are you gonna buy?'
'I'm not sure, what should I buy?'
'What the hell...'
We arrived at Windy.
After walking on the hot streets, the cooled air\ninside is irresistibly comfortable.
'Hee hee hee!'
Ageha has a strange smile on her face as she\nwalks.
'We're shopping aren't we, so where do you want\nto go?'
'Anywhere is OK, I just want to browse, and if I\nsee something I want, I'll buy it.'
'Hey... Aren't I supposed to be carrying your\nbags?'
'If I find something I want you to carry, you can\ndo it then.'
'Am I just here to help you kill time?'
'No, we're just shopping, that's all.'
'I'm not really sure what you mean.'
'...I came here to buy feelings.'
'Feelings?'
'Yes, feelings.'
'I ain't gon' lose! Ain't no way!'
'You're talking kinda strangely.'
'Ah ain't never gon' lose!'
'That's even more strange!'
'Well, that's what I mean.'
'I still don't understand!'
'Ah ha ha! First of all, let's have some juice or\nice cream. Which is it to be? My treat.'
'Hmm, which one...'
'...Wait, if I know you like I think I do,\nthere's something you want me to do, isn't\nthere?'
'No, not at all. Why do you treat people with\nsuch suspicion?'
'Well, it's true that there is something I want\nyou to do.'
'I want you to help me buy feelings.'
'I just told you, I don't understand what you\nmean...'
'The advisor.'
Ageha spoke over me.
'We can't find one, can we?'
'I guess not.'
'We still haven't given up but, on a day like\ntoday, we've got nothing to do, do we?'
'Thinking about all these annoying things kind of\nmakes my heart sink.'
'You?'
To be honest, I didn't expect this from her.
Ageha is always so cheerful and optimistic... I\nthought that she'd never been depressed in her\nlife.
'Who do you think I am? The woman of steel? An\nexpressionless girl with FRP plastered on her\nface?'
'I didn't say that.'
'Well, I sometimes sink to rock bottom too, you\nknow.'
'You do look kind of heavy, I guess.'
'Oh, you are just the worst!'
'In that case, let's get some juice.'
'Yeah yeah.'
'Like I said, I'll pay for yours. What'll it be?'
'I'll just have water.'
While doing pilot training for the glider, I've\nbeen running and weight training, and watching\nwhat I eat.
If you can tone up your body, you can react more\nquickly when maneuvering.
Ageha knew that already, so she didn't say\nanything about it, and bought me some water.
'I'll have this new recipe. Here you go.'
'OK, this one.'
I put the coins in, push the button, and hear the\nsound of something falling.
Vending machines sure are amazing.

It's been a year since I transferred to Keifuu
Academy. The more I study machinery, the more I
respect technology, or rather, the people who
make it.
These things are all around us, and are a\nculmination of knowledge and technology.
It's not just vending machines, even this juice,\nis a marvel of this kind of extraordinary\ntechnology...
'It's gonna go warm isn't it? Can I have it,\nplease?'
Taking this marvel of technology, Ageha just\nopens it up and starts drinking it.
'Gulp, gulp, gulp...'
She swigs it back with considerable momentum.
'...I'm not sure if I like this.'
'Is it kind of horrible?'
'It's not horrible but it's not like it's that\nmuch better than the other flavors up until now.\nIt's hard to judge.'
'I see.'
'Well, it could last half a year, or at worst,\nit'll have disappeared by fall.'
'It's a tricky one.'
'There are so many different things. It must be\nreally tough to make a new one.'
'That's why, I think that Amane is so awesome.'
'Yeah. She made a new design for a glider, didn't\nshe?'
'So that means that we are awesome too, because\nwe're going to build and fly it!'
'Oh, I see.'
'Soaring Club, aim for the top! Woo-hoo!'
'Can you stop that? It's kind of embarrassing.'
'Come forth, advisor! The world is waiting for\nyou!'
'Even if you shout it out loud...'
'Can't you just go along with it?'
'Woo-hoo!'
'Woah, that guy is sooooo embarrassing!'
'Hey!'
Ageha dashes off with a smile on her face.
'C'mon, just try and catch me!'
'If you don't chase me, I'll run around all the\nstores shouting your name with tears in my eyes!'
'Why do you want to suddenly start playing some\nkind of forfeit game that could ruin my life!'
I chase after her, with a wry smile.
Of course, Ageha and I don't actually run around\nin places like this.
Just like how we played in the past, we naturally\nmake a rule between ourselves that there is 'No\nrunning'.
'Ahahahaha!'
Pitter patter pitter patter.
'Wait, wait, wait!'
Stomp stomp stomp stomp.
Like a walking race, Ageha walks away as quickly\nas she can, while I chase her.
From the underground level, we go to the first,\nthe second, the third and finally, the fourth\nfloor, where Himegi Sports is.
'Oh, Ageha and Aoi... huh?'
A voice called out from the store but we went\nstraight past.
Sorry, Mr. Himegi, see you next time.
'C'mon, c'mon, you still can't catch me!'
'Why you...!'
We go back down to the lower levels, walking\naround the wide open floor, down the stairs, up\nthe stairs, walking around the floor again...
'Huff, puff, huff, puff, OK... no more...'
Ageha slumped down on a bench, loosening her\ncollar, and tried to catch her breath.
'Don't go thinking you can beat me when it comes\nto endurance.'
'I guess you're right, huff, puff...'
Ageha kept wiping off her sweat.
Naturally, I'm tired too but not as much as\nAgeha.
'Phew... Geez, why did we come all the way here,\ninside where it's cool, and then end up sweating\nlike this?'
'Hey, this brings back memories!'
'...Brings back memories?'
'Of the secret base.'
'Oh.'

When Ageha and I talk about the 'secret base', we
don't mean the place where we're making the
glider, we mean the place where we used to play
as kids.
Now, it's been knocked down to make space for\nWindy Kazegaura, but that place holds a lot of\nmemories for us.
'I think I went a little too far with my little\njoke...'
'You're right, I did too...'
It felt like we'd gone back to being kids again,\nbut it's true that I got quite excited about\nchasing her.
Well, I guess it did feel pretty good.
'It must've been around this area.'
'Oh yeah... I guess so.'
If the shopping street that was once here was\nstill here now, then the secret base would be\nwhere we are now.
The secret base...
It was a store of some sort, but after the store\nclosed down, no new tenants moved in, and it was\njust left to rot, so it was literally a ruin.

They started to demolish it but there was a
problem with the funds for the demolition, so
they stopped halfway through and left it like
that... I remember hearing something like that,
anyway.
We were just little kids, so we didn't really\nknow, but that's what An-chan told us.

Well, to kids our age who didn't really
understand difficult things like that, the fact
that it was a great place to play was the most
important thing.

We could climb on the outer walls, squeeze our
little bodies through the cracks where it had
started to collapse, finding paths inside, and
going deeper and deeper inside...
If any adults came past, we'd give a signal,\ncrouch down to hide ourselves, and we were very\nserious about it.
That kind of thing was really fun.

Basically, those were the kind of games that boys
play, but Ageha came with Masatsugu and I, or
rather, it was her idea, and we played there
together.
'Yeah, it does bring back memories, doesn't\nit...?'
'Yeah...'
In the 'secret base', there was a second floor\nand a roof.
We only played on the second floor.
That would be right where we are now, sitting on\nthis bench... not just the horizontal position,\nbut the height too.
Around here, Ageha and I would crouch down and\nrun around while playing tag or shooting each\nother with water pistols.
That place no longer exists.
We can't go back to that time.
'We were in the sixth grade... I think.'
Ageha and I have both changed.
We've grown bigger and had many experiences.
An-chan has started working, and we are also\nfollowing our own paths.
Those nostalgic memories, stay as memories, but\ndrift further and further away...
'But everyone's still here.'
Ageha spoke as if tries to ease my feelings of\nsentimentality.
'The secret base has gone... but we're still\nhere... in the same place.'
'...Yeah.'
I understand what she's saying.
There's me, Ageha, Masatsugu, Hotaru and An-chan.
It's true, all of us from back then are still\nhere.
We're still here... just about.
'I was so happy when you came back, Aoi.'
'And also, for being just how you were before...'
'It's the same as when we played here, like we're\ngoing back to that time.'
'But... we're not kids anyway.'
'Yeah, I know.'
This town isn't the same as it was in the past.
When I returned to this place, I was taken aback\nby how much the town had changed.
The windmills by the lake, and Windy Kazegaura\ntoo.
And by the fact the shopping street, that I have\nso many fond memories of, was gone too.
'It's not the same anymore...'
'What's not the same?'
'Umm... Ah... Well, this and that, y'know.'
'Yeah... I guess we did a lot of different things\nback then.'
There are also many things that make me break\ninto a cold sweat when I recall them now, that\ncan't just be passed off as kids playing.
On a hot day like today, we'd shoot passers-by\nwith our water pistols.
We used a measured length of rope for bungee\njumping, and so on... and An-chan would get\nreally mad with us.
Masatsugu and I, using the same rope, would\nchallenge each other to see who could stay\nupside-down for the longest.
We suffered from blood congestion, and after we\ngot down, we felt faint from anemia.
Are those the kind of things that Ageha meant?
'Yeah, this and that. So many things happened.\nWe've done lots of reckless things, haven't we?'
'We have...?'
There's something strange about Ageha's mood.
Did something happen when I moved away?
But it's been a year since I came back. If it was\nanything important, she would've told me about it\nalready.
'As long as we're all here, we can find new\nthings to enjoy together. Right?'
'Yeah, I guess you're right.'
'...I'm not sure about Masatsugu, though.'
'That traitor... He should go out with Hotaru, so\nwhy is he chasing after the student council\npresident?'
'Hold on, I think that's going a bit too far.'
'If that were the case, you and I would have to\nget together.'
'Hmm?'
Did I say something strange?
'Erm... I guess so, yeah.'
'But we spend a lot of time together, and we're\ntogether right now... so it's a bit late for\nthat... ?'
'Yeah, I guess so.'
To tell the truth, after I said, I felt a little\nscared.
Ageha didn't really respond to it though, so I\njust kind of let it slide.
'Phew... Oh, now I'm really sweating.'
Ageha was sweating quite a lot, as she took a\nbreather.
'Wait here.'
I went to buy a sports drink.
'Thanks...'
'Gulp, gulp, gulp, gulp, gulp.'
Her throat moves up and down as she gulps it down\neven more forcefully than before.
For some reason, I found myself looking at the\nmovements of her throat.
It's white and different to a boy's, since\nthere's no part that sticks out.
Her throat was constantly moving... and her\nexposed collarbone was also moving.
The lines of her chin and neck are round and\nsmooth, and her skin is glistening.
'Whew... It tastes great...!'
She seemed happy as a wide grin spread across her\nsweaty face.
Even though I'm not drinking, my throat made the\nsame kind of movement.
'...That's strange, you don't have a suntan at\nall, do you?'
'Yeah, well, I move around a lot but I spend most\nof the time indoors.'
'I only really went outside when we went to cut\nthe grass.'
After she had finished drinking, Ageha was\ngetting ready to throw the plastic bottle into\nthe trashcan.
It's quite far away.
'What is it?'
'Well... if I just throw it normally, it won't\nfly in a straight line, will it?'
'I dunno about cans, but a plastic bottle\nwouldn't, would it?'
'So, what should I do to make something this\nshape fly straight?'
'If you could put wings on it, like here...'
If the bottle is like the fuselage of a plane,\nwe'd have the main wings, tailplane, vertical\ntailplane... Hmm.
'Why are we talking about this?'
'I only ever think about two things.'
'Two? The first must be the glider, right?'
'Yeah, you got it straight away. You know me\nwell.'
'That's because we've been together for so\nlong... I'm the same.'
'...Eh heh heh. I see. That's good.'
She smiles happily, so why do I have this strange\nuneasy feeling?
'What's the other thing?'
'Oh, I wonder?'
Ageha's eyes sparkle, with an air of mystery\nabout her.
What could it be?
'It must be something to do with our club. Like\nwhat we're gonna do about the advisor.'
'Yeah...'
Huh? Her eyes are moving side to side.
It looks like I said something she wasn't\nexpecting.
'Well... that's it.'
'It's true. That's the most important thing right\nnow.'
In a strangely exaggerated fashion, she nods in\nagreement.
'Was it something else?'
'Alright, c'mon, let's head back.'
Without answering my question, Ageha, holding the\nbottle horizontally, starts running off.
'Take off! Whoosh!'
'Quit doing that, it's embarrassing.'
'Oh no, a downburst! We're losing speed!'
She throws it into the trashcan.
'Cut that out, it's bad luck!'
'So, it makes a recovery...!'
'Don't put your hand in the trashcan!'
'Huff, puff, huff...'
I feel a lot more tired than before...
'What's up? You look worn out.'
'Graaaaagh!'
Is it OK for me to get mad?
'Ahahaha! Thanks, though. The shopping's done.'
I blink with surprise.
'When did that happen?'
'I told you, didn't I? That I came to buy\nfeelings.'
'I bought a bright and sunny feeling!'
'I couldn't buy it by myself. So, thanks, Aoi.'
'Gimme a break...'
'What's that all about?'
'Well, when you come out with embarrassing lines\nlike that, I just of makes me... cringe, you\nknow?'
'Oh... Is that so...?'
Ageha's eyes light up, kind of like a cat's!
'Aoi Minase, sit down, please.'
'I'll whisper cringe-inducing things into your\near for all eternity!'
'Stop it!'
'Oh, seeing you all annoyed like this, will give\nme something to nostalgically look back upon,\nlike a page in the story of my youth.'
'No, no, no, no!'
'With everyone's power combined, let's fly, to\nthe future! Our bonds of friendship will never be\ntorn asunder!'
'Nooooooo!'
Cringe, cringe, cringe, I'm so embarrassed, I'm\ngonna die, die in agony!
'Hahaha... Now do you realize what the punishment\nis for laughing at people when they're being\nserious?'
'I understand, I'm sorry...'
I surrendered from the bottom of my heart.
'So, after all that, what was the other thing\nthat you are always thinking about?'
Being able to completely change the subject is\nanother great thing about being so used to each\nother.
We couldn't really do that with anyone else.
'I told you, right?'
'You did?'
'I told you. Well, that's it.'
I feel like she's avoided telling me the most\nimportant thing.
'So... what are we gonna do about the\nadvisor...?'
'Oh yeah...'

Unfortunately, we've gone from feeling all
cheerful, changing back to the topic of the lack
of an advisor, and the situation hasn't changed
at all.
What should we do...?
